item.title: Labour calls for 'inquiry' into outsourced NHS contract failings
item.description: Letter asks for 'urgent update' on the scale of problems that have left GP trainees unpaid
item.author: Alex Matthews-King
item.dc:creator: Alex Matthews-King

item.title: Japanese host Shinzo Abe forced to play second fiddle to ego of Donald Trump
item.description: US president insists on asserting his dominance in a passive-aggressive manner
item.author: David Nakamura
item.dc:creator: David Nakamura

item.title: Saudi Arabia 'corruption' arrests are a bold but risky attempt by Crown Prince bin Salman to seize power
item.description: Analysis: Sweep of high-level arrests, which government says is aimed at eliminating corruption, also appears to be aimed at stamping out potential rivals or critics of Prince Mohammed
item.author: Aya Batrawy
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy
item.media:text: Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman has pledged a 'moderate, open' Saudi Arabia, breaking with ultra-conservative clerics in favour of catering to foreign investors and Saudi youth (Picture: AFP/Getty)

item.title: East London acid attack survivor dismisses Government crackdown as a 'joke' after two attacks in 30 minutes
item.description: New laws and restrictions have not yet come into effect as consultations continue
item.author: Lizzie Dearden
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Dearden
item.media:text: Acid attack victim Jabed Hussain (centre) during a demonstration in Parliament Square on 18 July (Picture: PA)

item.title: Madeleine McCann detectives travel to Bulgaria in search of paedophile's widow
item.description: On the evening of the toddler's disappearance an eyewitness saw a woman staring intently at the apartment block next to where the McCann's were staying
item.author: Shehab Khan
item.dc:creator: Shehab Khan
item.media:text: Madeleine McCann (Picture: Getty)

item.title: 'Broad-based' flu vaccine could provide basis for life-long immunisations
item.description: New jab primes the immune system against parts of the virus which are common in multiple different flu strains
item.author: Alex Matthews-King
item.dc:creator: Alex Matthews-King
item.media:text: Figures show that by the end of last week, 48.9 per cent of patients aged 65 or older had the flu jab, but in the same week in 2011, 54.8 per cent of pensioners had received it. (Picture: pa)

item.title: TfL removes 'Free Balochistan' adverts from London black cabs after pressure from Pakistani government
item.description: The World Baloch Organisation says the Pakistani government has put pressure on the UK Foreign Office and Transport for London to remove the adverts
item.author: Caroline Mortimer
item.dc:creator: Caroline Mortimer
item.media:text: Black cabs with the poster on them outside Buckingham Palace in west London on 6 November (Picture: World Baloch Organisation)

item.title: Anthony Weiner begins prison sentence for sexting underage girl
item.description: The Boston prison has has more than 1,000 inmates at the medical centre and over 100 more at an adjacent minimum security satellite camp
item.author: Staff and agency
item.dc:creator: Staff and agency
item.media:text: Former U.S. Rep. Anthony Weiner leaves Federal court, Friday, May 19, 2017, in New York. Weiner pleaded guilty to a charge of transmitting sexual material to a minor and could get years in prison (Picture: AP/Mary Altaffer)

item.title: Theresa May will not sack Priti Patel for secret Israel meetings 'because no damage was done'
item.description: Prime Minister admits she did not know her cabinet minister met Benjamin Netanyahu until last Friday – more than two months later
item.author: Rob Merrick
item.dc:creator: Rob Merrick
item.media:text: Priti Patel: future Tory leader? (Picture: Getty Images)

item.title: New teacher says he quit after one term for his 'emotional and psychological wellbeing'
item.description: 'I felt that what was expected of us was astronomical'
item.author: Rachael Revesz
item.dc:creator: Rachael Revesz

item.title: Camp Speicher massacre: Retracing the steps of Isis's worst ever atrocity
item.description: Iraq Reborn: As Isis is driven out of the last few towns under its control, Patrick Cockburn visits the scene where more than 1,700 young air cadets were slaughtered by the group. More than three years later, there are still grisly tell-tale signs of what happened here
item.author: Patrick Cockburn
item.dc:creator: Patrick Cockburn
item.media:text: Remnants of a body belonging to Shia soldiers from Camp Speicher (Picture: Reuters)

item.title: Manchester attack survivors say they watched victims die while waiting for medical attention
item.description: Ambulance service says only three paramedics deployed inside blast-hit foyer because they were triaging patients
item.author: Lizzie Dearden
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Dearden
item.media:text: Armed police officers stand near the Manchester Arena, where US singer Ariana Grande had been performing when the attack took place (Picture: Andrew Yates/Reuters)

item.title: British Airways to bring back second meal for long-haul flights
item.description: 'We will upgrade catering so that everyone has better snacks and, on longer flights, everyone has a full second meal' — Alex Cruz, British Airways CEO
item.author: Simon Calder
item.dc:creator: Simon Calder
item.media:text: Flag carrier: British Airways Boeing 787 at Heathrow (Picture: British Airways)

item.title: Liberal Democrat members share sexual assault and harassment allegations amid Westminster sex abuse scandal

item.dc:creator: Lizzy Buchan
item.media:text: Party merchandise for sale at the Liberal Democrats autumn conference in Brighton, Sussex (Picture: PA)

item.title: Murder conviction in jeopardy after judge 'refuses to touch envelopes from HIV-positive defendant'
item.description: Kaushal Niroula was convicted of murdering an elderly man but his conviction could be overturned after judge said he had not read court motions he submitted
item.author: Caroline Mortimer
item.dc:creator: Caroline Mortimer
item.media:text: The sentence in the Stanford case has been described as 'an anomoly' (Picture: iStock)

item.title: John Kerry: Donald Trump's verdict against Iran deal not based on 'any fact whatsoever'

item.author: Kim Sengupta

item.media:text: Former US Secretary of State John Kerry reflects on the success of the Iran deal during an event at Chatham House (Picture: Getty Images)

item.title: Texas shooting: Devin Kelley killed a baby aged 18 months, police confirm
item.description: The Texas church shooter Devin Kelley killed a baby aged only 18 months during the massacre that killed at least 26 people on Sunday afternoon, police have announced.
item.author: Clark Mindock
item.dc:creator: Clark Mindock
item.media:text: Law enforcement officials continue their investigation at Sutherland Springs Baptist Church during the early morning hours of November 6 (Picture: Getty Images)

item.title: Britain would be 'booming' if it weren't for Brexit, says Bank of England Governor Mark Carney

item.author: Ben Chapman
item.dc:creator: Ben Chapman
item.media:text: Mark Carney announces that the Bank of England has increased interest rates (Picture: EPA)

item.title: Texas gunman shot up mother-in-law's church after sending her threatening messages
item.description: The Texas gunman, identified as Devin Patrick Kelley, 26, fired on the church attended by his mother-in-law after he sent "threatening" text messages to her, officials have said.
item.author: Jon Herskovitz
item.dc:creator: Jon Herskovitz
item.media:text: Officials speak to the news media during a news conference a day after the shooting (Picture: Jon Herskovitz/Reuters)

item.title: US interests must be protected in post-Brexit EU-UK trade deal, says Wilbur Ross
item.description: Speaking at a conference hosted by the Confederation of British Industry, Mr Ross said that he hoped the US could become the UK's number one trading partner after Brexit

item.media:text: Many who fled from the ruined display at The Antrobus Arms Hotel ran 'with their clothes on fire' (Picture: Screengrab)

item.dc:creator: Mythili Sampathkumar
item.media:text: The leaked trove of millions of documents dubbed the Paradise Papers has revealed ties between White House advisor and US President Donald Trump's son-in-law and Russian state entities.

item.title: John Mollo: Costume designer who brought Star Wars to life

item.media:text: After picking up an Oscar for his work on 'A New Hope' in 1978, Mollo earned further distinction on films such as 'Alien' and 'Gandhi' (Picture: Getty)

item.title: UK car registrations slump in October weighed by uncertainty around Government's diesel policy
item.description: New diesel and petrol cars and vans will be banned from 2040 as part of Government efforts to tackle air pollution, but rules around diesel vehicles currently hitting the market have so far been vague

item.dc:creator: Josie Cox

item.title: Paradise papers: Labour calls for 'withholding tax' to stop companies shifting profits offshore before government takes it share
item.description: John McDonnell also demanded the Government force tax havens to reveal who uses them

item.title: US President trumps Abe by upending box of food into Tokyo palace koi carp pond

item.title: UK living wage increase provides 150,000 workers with pay rise
item.description: A report over the weekend showed that more than a fifth of people working in the UK are still earning a salary that is below the living wage

item.media:text: The Living Wage is currently £9.15 an hour in London and £7.85 in the rest of the UK (Rex) (Picture: Rex)

item.title: Fifth of UK's population earns less than living wage, finds research
item.description: The real UK living page currently stands at £8.45 per hour outside of London and £9.75 within the capital. An update on those figures is due to be announced on Monday

item.title: EasyJet reports nearly 10% jump in passengers during October
